school: School of Nursing, Allied Health, and Biological Sciences

vision_mission.university: We envision Saint Louis University as an excellent missionary and transformative educational institution zealous in developing locally responsive, globally competitive, and empowered human resources who are creative, competent, socially involved, and imbued with Christian spirit.
vision_mission.school: We envision the School of Nursing, Allied Health and Biological Sciences – Nursing Program as the seat of excellence in Nursing Education that is dynamic and inspired by Christian way of living, producing locally responsive, globally competitive, and value-laden nurses in service of humanity.

program_educational_objectives: Demonstrate excellent technical knowledge and competency in nursing practice, informatics, and the design and evaluation of evidence-based interventions.
Practice entrepreneurial skills in nursing education, research, and management.
Participate effectively in the nursing discipline through communication, collaboration, and interpersonal management skills grounded in Christian values.
Demonstrate social responsibility in addressing community and individual health needs using sound decision-making based on nursing standards.
program_learning_outcomes: Integrate knowledge from health sciences, social sciences, and humanities in nursing practice.
Apply evidence-based guidelines and principles in care delivery.
Perform safe, appropriate, humanistic, and holistic care using the nursing process.
Communicate effectively in written, oral, and culturally appropriate forms.
Report and document care accurately and comprehensively.
Demonstrate beginning leadership and management skills.
Participate in research and development projects.
Utilize techno-intelligent care systems and processes.
Apply entrepreneurial skills in health care delivery.
Practice nursing within legal, ethical, and moral frameworks.
Collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary and multicultural teams.
Engage in lifelong learning in tune with global and national trends.
Exhibit responsible citizenship and Filipino Louisian nurse pride.
Apply nursing care values in professional practice.
Practice Christian values personally and professionally, aligned with the CICM mission.
admission_qualifications_philippine_scho: Must be a STEM graduate or equivalent (evaluated by the Program Head)
Must rank within quota limits for the Nursing Program
admission_qualifications_foreign_schools: Must be a fresh high school graduate of the STEM strand or its equivalent
Must rank within quota limits for the Nursing Program
admission_requirements: Official Grade 12 report card (signed by school head)
Signed UNDERTAKING (student and parent), with 2x2 photo
Laboratory results (Urinalysis, CBC, X-Ray, Hepatitis screening)
Vaccination certificate (2 primary + 1 booster dose) from https://vaxcert.doh.gov.ph/

practice: Local and international hospital nursing practice
research: Researcher roles in local (e.g. DOH) and international institutions
education: Academic roles locally and internationally (faculty, clinical instructor)

office_location: Dean’s Office, Room S505, Diego Silang Building, SLU Main Campus, Bonifacio Road, Baguio City, Philippines
